title: Sadako Ogata | UC Berkeley Political Science

quotes: In 1991, Sadako Ogata became the first woman, the first Japanese person, and the first academic to be named the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR).
A 1963 graduate, she was a Japanese academic, diplomat, author, administrator, and professor emeritus at the Roman Catholic Sophia University.
